name: Life expectancy
description: Average life expectancy for both men and women is {N} years
info: The average number of years a newborn is expected to live if factors like death rates remain constant. Derived from sources including UN population projections, census reports, and Eurostat demographic statistics.

name: Infant mortality
description: {N} children out of 1,000 died before age one
info: The number of deaths of infants less than one year old per 1,000 live births in a given year. Estimates by the UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation.

name: Maternal mortality ratio
description: {N} mothers die per 100,000 live births due to complications during pregnancy and childbirth
info: The number of deaths of women who are pregnant or who terminated pregnancy within the previous 42 days from causes related to or aggravated by pregnancy per 100,000 live births.
full_name: Maternal mortality ratio (modeled estimate, per 100,000 live births)

name: Health expenditure
description: The annual spending on health care services per person is {N}
info: The total amount of money spent on health care in a given country divided by that country’s population for the same year. This includes both public and private spending on medical products and services, preventative care, public health measures, and all other medical costs.

name: Mortality rate from non-communicable disease
description: {N} people per 100,000 die from non-communicable diseases every year
info: Deaths per 100,000 people from non-communicable diseases, like heart disease and cancer, adjusted based on the age distribution for each country.

name: Gun deaths
description: {N} gun related deaths per 100,000 people
info: The number of deaths from firearms per 100,000 people, including homicides, suicides, and accidents.

name: Homicides
description: {N} people per 100,000 were murdered
info: The number of intentional homicides per 100,000 people. Intentional homicide is defined by the United Nations as “unlawful death purposefully inflicted on a person by another person”.

name: Prison population
description: {N} people per 100,000 are in jail
info: The total number of incarcerated individuals in a given country per 100,000 people in the country in the same year. This includes prisoners awaiting trial.

name: Military expenditure
description: {N} of the GDP is spent on military forces
info: The total amount of money spent on armaments, international security, and other military-related expenditures in a given year divided by the total value of all goods and services produced by the same country in the same year.

name: Global Peace Index
description: The Global Peace Index is {N} (lower is better)
info: The Global Peace Index is an indicator created by the Institute for Economics & Peace to gauge global peace. It comprises 23 indicators and ranks 163 states and territories. A lower score indicates a more peaceful country.

name: Years of education
description: People ages 25-34 average {N} years of education
info: The average years of education received by adults 25 years and older. Education attainment levels are converted to years based on the average duration of each level.

name: High school education
description: {N} of people ages 25-34 completed high school
info: Percent of adults ages 25-34 who have attained at least an upper-secondary (high school) education.

name: Institutional spending
description: {N} per student is spent on educational expenses each year
info: Average annual expenditure per student by educational institutions for all services from primary school through college in equivalent USD.

name: PISA math, reading, and science scores
description: The average PISA score for all three categories is {N}
info: Mean score on the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA) exam. The exam is composed of three sections: math, reading, and science. This indicator uses the average score of the three sections.

name: Teacher’s salary (primary education)
description: Elementary school teachers average salary is {N} per year
info: Median annual pre-tax salary of public primary school teachers with at least 10 years of experience, in equivalent USD.

name: College education
description: {N} of people ages 25-34 hold a bachelor’s degree or higher
info: Percent of adults ages 25-34 holding at least a bachelor’s degree or equivalent. This includes adults who hold master’s and doctoral degrees.

name: Voter turnout
description: {N} of eligible voters cast a ballot in a parliamentary or congressional election
info: Voter turnout of age-eligible population in congressional or parliamentary elections based on data from national election management, statistics, and census bureaus. Year of most recent data varies by country.

name: Voice and accountability
description: Freedom of speech and participation in government has a value of {N} on a scale from -2.5 to 2.5 (higher is better)
info: Voice and accountability is an indicator developed by the World Bank to gauge the extent to which citizens can select their government, as well as factors including freedom of expression, association, and media.

name: Control of corruption
description: Public perception of government corruption has a value of {N} on a scale from -2.5 to 2.5 (higher is better)
info: Control of corruption is an indicator developed by the World Bank to gauge perceptions of the extent to which public officials use their power for private gain.

name: Income inequality
description: The Gini index of income inequality is a value of {N} on a scale from 0 to 1 (lower is better)
info: The Gini index is a measure of income distribution on a scale from zero to one, with zero representing perfect equality in income distribution and one representing perfect inequality.

name: Income mobility
description: The ability for a person to move outside their income class has a value of {N} on a scale from 0 to 1 (lower is better)
info: The percent change in a son’s income explained by a 1% increase in his father’s income. A lower score signifies greater income mobility between generations.

name: Gender inequality
description: Women’s reproductive health, empowerment, and labor force participation has a value of {N} (lower is better)
info: A measure of gender in equality based on factors including percent of seats in parliament, maternal mortality, education, and labour market participation. Expressed on a scale from zero to one with a high value representing greater inequality.

name: Women’s share of parliament
description: Women hold {N} of seats in parliament or congress
info: The percent of seats held by women in the national parliament, congress, or equivalent elected governing body.
